creator: jeguillen@gmail.com
text:
I installed apache 2.0.53 with php 5 and SSL using openSSL 0.9.7e on a IBM 205
server running RedHat 9,before this I was using apache 2.0.47 with php 4 and no
SSL on the same server.
At first everything went fine, until I noticed (next day) that there are 3 httpd
procs. that are using 100% CPU. When you restart the apache, the procs go down
to normal (near 0% cpu) but slowly they increase their cpu usage as time passes
by. Apache and php are working, but I know is not normal for apache to use 100%
cpu. I checked the log files and I don't see any errors reported. I am also
using Tomcat 4.1.27 to run my java apps.I am a novice in apache and don't know
what else to do or look for.

Thanks.

Please attach to one of the children eating CPU with gdb like:

 # gdb /path/to/your/bin/httpd <PID>

and then enter "backtrace" to get a backtrace.

I said yes to this and the httpd process was killed. Then I tried again and said

and it responded: couldn't get registers: operation not permited. Maybe I am
doing something wrong???!!!!!

creator: jeguillen@gmail.com
text:
I couldn't find any way out to solve this problem so I re-compiled my old 2.0.47
apache to support SSL using openSSL 0.9.7e and php5 and problem solved.

Try adding "CoreDumpDirectory /tmp" to httpd.conf, and make sure you are running
the RHL9 kernel updates, or try a more recent distribution.  Without a backtrace
there's little clue as to what the problem could be, so we can't fix it.
